text: Yeah of course. Feel free to send whatever you like and I will give you feedback.
If you send a password protected Vimeo (or other video host) link, that's probably the best way.

I have also offered CV advice to others mentees (not sure if that's the word?) from Prospela so if you want me to look at your CV or cover letterthen go ahead. Redact any personal contact details first of course.

As for a putting together a reel, it's good to have some stuff on your reel that really relates to the area that you're interested in. I know you mentioned Houdini and Matchmove, so it would be good to try and include some of that kind of thing. Not necessarily right now but maybe something to think about for the future.
///
Also some general tips for reels, apologies if you've heard this before:

Thanks again for helping me so much. Entering the industry is scary, but it makes it much less intimidating the more I understand about it.

During this huge advert, everybody has been given little job roles, and I got given my section, which is an entirely CG space scene, most of the tracking and a couple of Houdini simulations throughout. Hopefully Iâ€™ll get enough stuff to put into a showreel after that. 
How do people usually represent matchmoving in a showreel? I feel like matchmoving never looks impressive.
